Class Student

java.lang.Object
Student
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, Searchable<Student>
Direct Known Subclasses:
GraduateStudent, UndergraduateStudent
public abstract class Student extends Object implements Comparable, Searchable<Student>
The Student class represents a student with a name and a list of enrolled courses. It is an abstract class that provides a foundation for different types of students (e.g., undergraduate, graduate). Implements the Searchable interface to allow keyword-based matching and equality checks.

  • Constructor Details

    • Student

      public Student()
      Constructs a Student object with a default name "unknown".

    • Student

      public Student(String name)
      Constructs a new Student object with the specified name. Initializes an empty course list.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the student

    • Student

      public Student(String studentID, String name)
      Constructs a new Student object with the specified ID and name. Initializes an empty course list.
      Parameters:
      studentID - the ID of the student
      name - the name of the student

    • Student

      public Student(Student ob)
      Copy constructor. Creates a deep copy of the given Student object. Copies the name and duplicates all courses.
      Parameters:
      ob - the Student object to copy

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the name of the student as a string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the student's name

    • addCourse

      public void addCourse(Course c)
      Adds a course to the student's course list. A deep copy of the course is added to avoid aliasing.
      Parameters:
      c - the course to add

    • introduce

      public void introduce()
      Prints the student's name followed by their list of enrolled courses. Each course is listed with its index in the course list.

    • duplicate

      public abstract Student duplicate()
      Creates and returns a duplicate of the student. This method must be implemented by subclasses to return a new instance that is a copy of the current student.
      Returns:
      a copy of the student

      Returns the name of the student.

      public int getTotalCredit()

      Returns:
      the total credit hours

    • getTuitionDue

      public double getTuitionDue()
      Calculates the total tuition due based on the total credits and the rate returned by getRate(). Demonstrates the Template Method design pattern.
      Returns:
      the total tuition due

    • getRate

      public abstract double getRate()
      Returns the tuition rate per credit hour. Must be implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      the rate per credit

    • getInfo

      public abstract String getInfo()
      Returns additional student information. Must be implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      a string with student-specific information

    • getStatus

      public abstract String getStatus()
      Returns the status of the student (e.g., undergraduate or graduate). Must be implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      the student's status

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Object obj)
      Compares this Student object with the specified object for order. The comparison is primarily based on the student's status (e.g., undergraduate, graduate). If the statuses are equal, the comparison falls back to lexicographically comparing the students' names.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be compared, which is expected to be a Student.
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this Student is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified Student. - Returns the result of comparing statuses if they differ. - Returns the result of comparing names if statuses are equal.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the specified object is not a Student.

    • isMatch

      public boolean isMatch(String key)
      Determines if the student's name contains the given search key (case-insensitive).
      Specified by:
      isMatch in interface Searchable<Student>
      Parameters:
      key - the string to search for
      Returns:
      true if the student's name contains the key, false otherwise

    • isEqual

      public boolean isEqual(Student obj)
      Checks if this student is equal to another object by comparing names.
      Specified by:
      isEqual in interface Searchable<Student>
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the names are equal, false otherwise

    • getCourseList

      public GenericList<Course> getCourseList()
      Returns a GenericList object containing all the student's enrolled courses. A new GenericList is constructed and populated with the student's courses.
      Returns:
      a GenericList of the student's courses

      public void setID(String studentID)
      Sets the student ID for this student.
      Parameters:
